type.description: Type of resource to add (only "function" is supported)
type.name: type

blueprints:add.description:
Scaffolds a new Sanity Function in your Blueprint. Functions are serverless handlers triggered by document events (create, update, delete, publish) or media library events.

After adding a function, use 'functions dev' to test locally, then 'blueprints deploy' to publish it.
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> function --name my-function --fn-type document-create --fn-type document-update --lang js

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

example.description: Example to use for the function resource. Discover examples at https://www.sanity.io/exchange/type=recipes/by=sanity
example.name: example

name.description: Name of the resource to add
name.name: name

fn-type.description: Document change event(s) that should trigger the function; you can specify multiple events by specifying this flag multiple times
fn-type.name: fn-type

fn-helpers.description: Add helpers to the new function
fn-helpers.name: fn-helpers

fn-installer.description: Which package manager to use when installing the @sanity/functions helpers
fn-installer.name: fn-installer

blueprints:add.summary: Add a function resource to a Blueprint

blueprints:config.description:
Manages the local Blueprint configuration, which links your Blueprint to a Sanity project and Stack.

Without flags, displays the current configuration. Use --edit to interactively modify settings, or combine --edit with ID flags to update values directly (useful for scripting and automation).

If you need to switch your Blueprint to a different Stack, use --edit --stack-id.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

edit.description: Modify the configuration interactively, or directly when combined with ID flags.
edit.name: edit

project-id.description: Directly set the project ID in the configuration. Requires --edit flag
project-id.name: project-id

organization-id.description: Directly set the organization ID in the configuration. Requires --edit flag
organization-id.name: organization-id

stack-id.description: Directly set the Stack ID in the configuration. Requires --edit flag
stack-id.name: stack-id

blueprints:config.summary: View or edit the local Blueprint configuration

blueprints:deploy.description:
Pushes your local Blueprint configuration to the remote Stack; provisioning, updating, or destroying resources as needed. This is the primary command for applying infrastructure changes.

Before deploying, run 'blueprints plan' to preview changes. After deployment, use 'blueprints info' to verify Stack status or 'blueprints logs' to monitor activity.

Use --no-wait to queue the deployment and return immediately without waiting for completion.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

no-wait.description: Do not wait for Stack deployment to complete
no-wait.name: no-wait

new-stack-name.description: Set a new name for the Stack
new-stack-name.name: new-stack-name

blueprints:deploy.summary: Deploy the local Blueprint to the remote Stack

blueprints:destroy.description:
Permanently removes the remote Stack and all its provisioned resources. Your local Blueprint files remain untouched, allowing you to redeploy later with 'blueprints init' + 'blueprints deploy'.

This is a destructive operation. You will be prompted to confirm unless --force is specified.

Use this to clean up test environments or decommission a Stack you no longer need.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

stack-id.description: Stack ID to destroy (defaults to current Stack)
stack-id.name: stack-id

no-wait.description: Do not wait for Stack destruction to complete
no-wait.name: no-wait

blueprints:destroy.summary: Destroy the remote Stack deployment and its resources (will not delete local files)

blueprints:doctor.description:
Analyzes your local Blueprint and remote Stack configuration for common issues, such as missing authentication, invalid project references, or misconfigured resources.

Run this command when encountering errors with other Blueprint commands. Use --fix to interactively resolve detected issues.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

blueprints:doctor.summary: Diagnose potential issues with local Blueprint and remote Stack configuration

blueprints:info.description:
Displays the current state and metadata of your remote Stack deployment, including deployed resources, status, and configuration.

Use this command to verify a deployment succeeded, check what resources are live, or confirm which Stack your local Blueprint is connected to.

Run 'blueprints stacks' to see all available Stacks in your project or organization.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

id.description: Stack ID to show info for (defaults to the current Stack)
id.name: id

blueprints:info.summary: Show information about the local Blueprint's remote Stack deployment

dir.description: Directory to create the local Blueprint in
dir.name: dir

blueprints:init.description:
A Blueprint is your local infrastructure-as-code configuration that defines Sanity resources (datasets, functions, etc.). A Stack is the remote deployment target where your Blueprint is applied.
[NOTE: Currently, accounts are limited to three (3) Stacks per project scope.]

This is typically the first command you run in a new project. It creates a local Blueprint manifest file (sanity.blueprint.ts, .js, or .json) and provisions a new remote Stack.
Additionally, a Blueprint configuration file is created in .sanity/ containing the scope and Stack IDs. This is .gitignored by default.

After initialization, use 'blueprints plan' to preview changes, then 'blueprints deploy' to apply them.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

dir.description: Directory to create the local Blueprint in
dir.name: dir

example.description: Example to use for the local Blueprint
example.name: example

blueprint-type.description: Blueprint manifest type to use for the local Blueprint
blueprint-type.name: blueprint-type

project-id.description: Sanity project ID used to scope local Blueprint and remote Stack
project-id.name: project-id

organization-id.description: Sanity organization ID used to scope local Blueprint and remote Stack
organization-id.name: organization-id

stack-id.description: Existing Stack ID used to scope local Blueprint
stack-id.name: stack-id

stack-name.description: Name to use for a new Stack provisioned during initialization
stack-name.name: stack-name

blueprints:init.summary: Initialize a local Blueprint and optionally provision a remote Stack deployment

blueprints:logs.description:
Retrieves Stack deployment logs, useful for debugging and monitoring deployment activity.

Use --watch (-w) to stream logs in real-time.

If you're not seeing expected logs, verify your Stack is deployed with 'blueprints info'.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

watch.description: Watch for new Stack logs (streaming mode)
watch.name: watch

blueprints:logs.summary: Display logs for the current Blueprint's Stack deployment

blueprints:plan.description:
Use this command to preview what changes will be applied to your remote Stack before deploying. This is a safe, read-only operationâ€”no resources are created, modified, or deleted.

Run 'blueprints plan' after making local changes to your Blueprint manifest to verify the expected diff. When ready, run 'blueprints deploy' to apply changes.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

blueprints:plan.summary: Enumerate resources to be deployed to the remote Stack - will not modify any resources

blueprints:stacks.description:
Shows all Stacks associated with a project or organization. By default, lists Stacks scoped to the local Blueprint.

Use this to discover existing Stacks you can scope a local Blueprint to (using 'blueprints config --edit'), or to audit what's deployed across your project.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

project-id.description: Project ID to show Stack deployments for
project-id.name: project-id

organization-id.description: Organization ID to show Stack deployments for
organization-id.name: organization-id

blueprints:stacks.summary: List all remote Stack deployments (defaults to the current Blueprint's project scope)

functions:add.description:
Scaffolds a new Function in the functions/ folder and templates a resource for your Blueprint manifest.

Functions are serverless handlers triggered by document events (create, update, delete, publish) or media library events.

After adding, use 'functions dev' to test locally, then 'blueprints deploy' to publish.
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --name my-function --type document-create --type document-update --lang js

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

example.description: Example to use for the Function
example.name: example

name.description: Name of the Function to add
name.name: name

type.description: Document change event(s) that should trigger the function; you can specify multiple events by specifying this flag multiple times
type.name: type

helpers.description: Add helpers to the new Function
helpers.name: helpers

functions:add.summary: Add a Function to your Blueprint

functions:dev.description:
Runs a local, web-based development server to test your functions before deploying.

Open the emulator in your browser to interactively test your functions with the payload editor.

Optionally, set the host and port with the --host and --port flags. Function timeout can be configured with the --timeout flag.

To invoke a function with the CLI, use 'functions test'.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

host.description: The local network interface at which to listen. [default: "localhost"]
host.name: host

port.description: TCP port to start emulator on. [default: 8080]
port.name: port

timeout.description: Maximum execution time for all functions, in seconds. Takes precedence over function-specific `timeout`
timeout.name: timeout

name.description: The name of the Sanity Function
name.name: name

functions:logs.description:
Fetches execution logs from a deployed function, useful for debugging production issues or monitoring activity.

Use --watch (-w) to stream logs in real-time. Use --delete to clear all logs for a function (requires confirmation unless --force is specified).

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

limit.description: Total number of log entries to retrieve
limit.name: limit

utc.description: Show dates in UTC time zone
utc.name: utc

delete.description: Delete all logs for the function
delete.name: delete

functions:logs.summary: Retrieve or delete logs for a Sanity Function

name.description: The name of the Sanity Function
name.name: name

functions:test.description:
Executes a function locally with the provided payload, simulating how it would run when deployed. Use this to test your function logic before deploying.

Provide test data via --data (inline JSON), --file (JSON file), or --document-id (fetch from Sanity). For update events, use the before/after flag pairs to simulate document changes.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

data.description: Data to send to the function
data.name: data

file.description: Read data from file and send to the function
file.name: file

document-id.description: Document to fetch and send to function
document-id.name: document-id

with-user-token.description: Prime access token from CLI config
with-user-token.name: with-user-token

media-library-id.description: Sanity Media Library ID to use
media-library-id.name: media-library-id

name.description: The name of the Sanity Function
name.name: name

key.description: The name of the environment variable
key.name: key

value.description: The value of the environment variable
value.name: value

functions:env:add.description:
Sets an environment variable in a deployed Sanity Function. If the variable already exists, its value is updated.

Environment variables are useful for API keys, configuration values, and other secrets that shouldn't be hardcoded. Changes take effect on the next function invocation.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

functions:env:add.summary: Add or set an environment variable for a deployed function

name.description: The name of the Sanity Function
name.name: name

functions:env:list.description:
Displays all environment variables (keys only) configured in a deployed Sanity Function.

Use 'functions env add' to set variables or 'functions env remove' to delete them.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

functions:env:list.summary: List environment variables for a deployed function

name.description: The name of the Sanity Function
name.name: name

key.description: The name of the environment variable
key.name: key

functions:env:remove.description:
Deletes an environment variable from a deployed Sanity Function. The change takes effect on the next function invocation.

Use 'functions env list' to see current variables before removing.

path.description: Path to a Blueprint file or directory containing one
path.name: path

functions:env:remove.summary: Remove an environment variable from a deployed function
